title: 103_hr1697
content:
The Act is titled the "Women in Military Service for America Memorial Commemorative Coin Act." It specifies the coin specifications. The Act "Women in Military Service for America Memorial Commemorative Coin Act" specifies the issuance of $5 gold coins and $1 silver coins. The $5 gold coins weigh 8.359 grams, have a diameter of 0.850 inches, and are composed of 90% gold and 10% alloy. The design of the gold coins symbolizes women's service in the Armed Forces, with inscriptions including "Liberty", "In God We Trust", and "E Pluribus Unum". The $1 silver coins weigh 26.73 grams. The $1 silver coins issued under the Act weigh 26.73 grams, have a diameter of 1.500 inches, and are composed of 90% silver and 10% copper. The design of the coins symbolizes women's service in the Armed Forces, with inscriptions including "Liberty", "In God We Trust", and "E Pluribus Unum". The coins are legal tender and numismatic items. The Secretary will obtain gold for minting coins under this Act and silver from stockpiles. The design for the coins will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations, and reviewed by a Citizens Commemorative Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF THE COINS.

The Secretary may issue coins minted under this Act from November 1, 1993, to December 31, 1994 in uncirculated and proof qualities at a designated Mint facility.

SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price not less than the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing the coins. Prepaid orders will be accepted at a discount, and a surcharge of $40 per $5 coin and $11 per $1 coin is required. SEC. 7. GENERAL WAIVER OF PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS. No procurement laws apply to goods/services for this Act. Equal Employment Opportunity laws still apply. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales go to Women in Military Service for America Memorial Foundation. SEC. 9. AUDITS. SEC. 9. The Comptroller General can audit the Women in Military Service for America Memorial Foundation, Inc. for expenditures under section 8. SEC. 10. Financial assurances required. SEC. 10. Financial assurances ensure no net cost to the Government for minting and issuing coins under section 2. Payment for coins requires full payment, security, or guarantee of payment from a depository institution.
